trustfund:
TF038525-INDIA:  MADHYA PRADESH DISTRICT
            POVERTY INITIATIVES,TF021582-DISTRICT POVERTY INITIATIVES
            PROJECT (DPIP),TF039274-INDIA - MADHYA PRADESH DISTRICT
            POVERTY INITIATIVE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Madhya Pradesh District Poverty
            Initiatives Project, aims at improving opportunities for the
            poor, and vulnerable groups, particularly women, in meeting
            their own social, and economic development activities,
            through the creation of income security opportunities for
            the rural poor, empowering disadvantaged groups through the
            promotion of village organizations. The project components
            follow. 1) Community investments will finance demand-driven
            sub-projects, proposed by the Common Interest Groups (CIGs),
            to be approved by the village development committees, and
            discussed by district sub-committees. Based on social
            assessments, it is expected that CIG subprojects will fall
            into three categories: a) skills and organizations, such as
            micro-enterprises; b) infrastructure, such as roads and
            housing; and, c) livelihood security, such as
            micro-irrigation. Village funds, established through
            community cash contributions would finance operation, and
            maintenance costs, and, Innovation Funds, would finance
            demonstration projects, proposed by non-governmental
            organizations. 2) Institutional, and human capacity building
            will develop self-reliant, and self managed community based
            organizations, focused on project administration, human
            resource development, communications, organization
            strengthening, and, monitoring and learning.
